name: cashew production | cashew | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19649/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Cashew which is a perineal crop which is harvested in the month of February, 2016 at a farm located in village Tutarkhed, District Valsad of Gujarat. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump and micro irrigation for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 580 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Harvesting date is 20-Feburary, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 279.50-57.50-21.6 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 510 kg of manure from cattle dung. Only insecticide used has active ingredient as Carbaryl 1275 g/ha, Organophosphate 1785g/ha. Machinery is used for plant protection with fuel consumption of 10 kg/ha, soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 25 kg/ha using plough for soil tillage and 5kg/ha is used for other work process by tractor, transport and trailer.   

As this crop is a peripheral crop it is continuously in process with periodic harvesting in a year.


The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Cashew from the Cashew plant.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0125:Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Harvesting date main crop: 20-Feburary, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Village Tutarkhed, District Valsad of Gujarat
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Cashew follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of cashew is calculated to be circa 5.28E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.06E-02 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.24E+00 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
